titleStmt.title: Translation: Receipt roll, Michaelmas 1309 to Michaelmas 1310: Alexander de Bicknor, treasurer of Ireland

editionStmt.edition: TEI/XML English translation of receipt roll, Michaelmas 1309 to Michaelmas 1310: William de Estdene, and Richard de Bereford, treasurers of Ireland.

publicationStmt.publisher: Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin

address.name: Beyond 2022: Ireland's Virtual Record Treasury
address.addrLine: Trinty College Dublin, the University of Dublin

seriesStmt.title: Accounts of the Irish Exchequer (The National Archives, E 101).

msIdentifier.msName: Receipt Roll: Alexander de Bicknor, treasurer of Ireland

physDesc.p: A parchment roll of thirteen membranes.

projectDesc.p: Created as part of the Medieval Gold Seam of the 'Beyond 2022: Ireland's Virtual Record Treasury' Research Project, Phase 2 (2019–22)

editorialDecl.p: The guiding principle is to make this edition of the accounts of the medieval Irish Exchequer (and other medieval records populating Beyond 2022 Virtual Record Treasury) as intelligible as possible to as wide an audience as possible. To that end, due to their generally brief, formulaic nature the records are more or less directly translated into modern English without losing the literal, technical sense of the original language, which is almost exclusively Latin.

div.head: Bicknor, treasurer
div.note: This is the only text on the pointed flap of the first membrane.

div.head: Roll of the great receipt of Alexander de Bicknor, treasurer of Ireland in Michaelmas term 3 Edward II and John de Hothum took the place tenentis locum of the same treasurer, who was in England.

head.date: Tuesday, the morrow of Michaelmas 30 September 1309

div.opener: Drogheda on the side of Uriel
div.ab: From the farm of Drogheda, by Geoffrey John: £20
From the mayor and bailiffs of Drogheda for the debts of various people, by the same Geoffrey: 8s 4d
From Walter Dounedale, sheriff, for the debts of various people: £10
From the same sheriff for the profit of the county: 40s

div.opener: Drogheda on the side of Meath
div.ab: From the farm of Drogheda, by Peter de Barton: 20 marks
From the issues of the great new custom, by Cruche Huberti: £12
From Walter le Bret, sheriff, for the debts of various people, by David Roche: £37
From Miles Prat, Elias Prat and other men of the community of the town of Duleek Doulek for a fine for trespass: 40s
From Robert Taaf, sheriff, for arrears of his account: 20s

div.closer: Sum received in five days: £97 15s 0d proved

div.ab: From Luke de Belinges, sheriff, for arrears of his account: 40s
From the mayor and bailiffs of the city of Dublin for their various debts: 10 marks

From John Pipe for the forfeit chattels of Robert Goldsmith aurifabri: 10s 11d
From David, bishop of Killaloe Kyldalo for a fine for trespass: £4

Nothing
Nothing

From Hugh son of Ralph and his associates for a fine for trespass: 40s
From Robert Maunsel for his various debts: 1/2 mark
From Walter Maunsel, chief serjeant, for contempt of court and because he did not levy the king's debts in the escheatry as he was ordered, by the escheator: 40s

head.date: Saturday, St Luke the Evangelist 18 October 1309

div.ab: Nothing
From the rent of Bray Bree, by William de Coventry Couyntre60s

div.head: Bicknor Wednesday 5 November 1309

div.head: Receipts in Trinity term in the abovesaid year

head.date: Monday, the morrow of the octave of Trinity, 22 June 1310

div.ab: From William son of Richard de Calne for a fine for his marriage: 1 mark

body.note: This membrane is blank other than a nineteenth-century title on the wrapper.
